title: Dysphemisms Quiz
description: Blunt or harsh alternatives to polite expressions

questions.question: What is a 'dysphemism'?
options: A polite way of saying something unpleasant
A deliberately harsh or blunt expression used instead of a polite one
A word that sounds like what it means
A figure of speech that exaggerates

questions.question: Which of the following is a dysphemism for 'died'?

What is the opposite of a dysphemism?
Which is a dysphemism for an old or used car?
'Pig' used to refer to a police officer is an example of:
Which is a dysphemism for 'eating quickly'?

Why do people sometimes use dysphemisms in conversation?
options: Because they don't know better words
For humor, emphasis, shock value, or to express strong disapproval
Because dysphemisms are more grammatically correct
